docs.snippet: The stretch of Post Road inhabited by Fuji Mart bears as much resemblance to Tokyo’s Ginza district as a chopstick does to a living tree. Yet once you step into this tiny shop, within a mirrored-glass cube building, you’ll feel as if you’ve ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The stretch of Post Road inhabited by Fuji Mart bears as much resemblance to Tokyo’s Ginza district as a chopstick does to a living tree. Yet once you step into this tiny shop, within a mirrored-glass cube building, you’ll feel as if you’ve been transported to Japan.

headline.print_headline: A Quick and Tasty Trip to Tokyo
headline.main: A Quick and Tasty Trip to Tokyo

docs.snippet: All the telltale signs of spring — apple blossoms, pea shoots, wooly lambs, piglets — can be found in the coming weeks at Stone Barns Center for Food and Agriculture, where sustainable farming underwritten by Rockefeller wealth has produced so...
docs.lead_paragraph: All the telltale signs of spring — apple blossoms, pea shoots, wooly lambs, piglets — can be found in the coming weeks at Stone Barns Center for Food and Agriculture, where sustainable farming underwritten by Rockefeller wealth has produced some of the most photogenic acres in the region. In addition to calves and tractors, there is wonderful food-to-go at the tiny Blue Hill Café, like a high-gloss chocolate tart, which on a recent March morning Philippe Gouze, the cafe manager, confessed to having had for breakfast.

docs.snippet: It’s exciting to wander the stalls of foreign bazaars, food halls and markets, with their stocks of rich and strange ingredients that promise, perhaps, a thrill of sweet discovery....
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s exciting to wander the stalls of foreign bazaars, food halls and markets, with their stocks of rich and strange ingredients that promise, perhaps, a thrill of sweet discovery.

docs.snippet: At Hamburgão, the five-year-old Brazilian burger-and-sandwich shop in the heart of the Ironbound district in Newark, you may find yourself asking, “Where’s the beef?”....
docs.lead_paragraph: At Hamburgão, the five-year-old Brazilian burger-and-sandwich shop in the heart of the Ironbound district in Newark, you may find yourself asking, “Where’s the beef?”.

docs.snippet: In just over seven years, Garelick and Herbs has become a mainstay of New Canaan life. “Garelick” is not a quaint Olde English spelling of garlic but the name of the owners, Jason and Paola Garelick, who have similar businesses in Westport and...
docs.lead_paragraph: In just over seven years, Garelick and Herbs has become a mainstay of New Canaan life. “Garelick” is not a quaint Olde English spelling of garlic but the name of the owners, Jason and Paola Garelick, who have similar businesses in Westport and Greenwich that also combine specialty deli foods and catering with a cafe.
